required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of a New Treatment in Combination With Laser for Diabetic Macular Edema

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of the intravitreal implant of dexamethasone with laser treatment vs. laser treatment alone in patients with diabetic macular edema.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With at Least 10 Letters of Improvement in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) From Baseline in the Study Eye
primary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured in the study eye using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly (ranging from 0 to 100 letters). The lower the number of letters read correctly on the eye chart, the worse the vision (or visual acuity). An increase in the number of letters read correctly indicates improvement and a decrease in the number of letters read correctly indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in BCVA in the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA is measured in the study eye using an eye chart and is reported as the number of letters read correctly (ranging from 0 to 100 letters). The lower the number of letters read correctly on the eye chart, the worse the vision (or visual acuity). An increase in the number of letters read correctly indicates improvement and a decrease in the number of letters read correctly indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Central Subfield Retinal Thickness in the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.description: Central subfield retinal thickness is assessed in the study eye by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT). The central subfield is an area in the retina (back of the eye). OCT is a laser-based, noninvasive, diagnostic system that provides high-resolution, three-dimensional images of the retina from which retinal thickness can be measured. A negative number change from baseline indicates an improvement and a positive number change from baseline indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Focal Leakage Area in the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.description: Focal leakage area in the study eye is assessed using fluorescein angiography. A positive number change from baseline indicates a worsening and a negative number change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Retreatment in the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.description: Time to retreatment in the study eye is defined as the number of days between the initial treatment and re-treatment with the study medication.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 700 µg Dexamethasone Implant and Laser Photocoagulation
arm_group.description: Initial intravitreal injection of 700 µg dexamethasone with up to 1 additional treatment based on re-treatment criteria. Initial laser photocoagulation with up to 3 additional treatments based on re-treatment criteria.
Initial sham injection with up to 1 additional treatment based on re-treatment criteria. Initial laser photocoagulation with up to 3 additional treatments based on re-treatment criteria.

intervention.description: Initial intravitreal injection of 700 µg dexamethasone with up to 1 additional treatment based on re-treatment criteria.
intervention.arm_group_label: 700 µg Dexamethasone Implant and Laser Photocoagulation

intervention.description: Initial sham injection with up to 1 additional treatment based on re-treatment criteria.
Initial laser photocoagulation with up to 3 additional treatments based on re-treatment criteria.
intervention.arm_group_label: 700 µg Dexamethasone Implant and Laser Photocoagulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older with diabetic macular edema
- Decrease in visual acuity in at least one eye as a result of macular edema (20/50 or worse)
- Visual acuity in other eye no worse than 20/200
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known anticipated need for ocular surgery within next 12 months
- History of glaucoma or current high eye pressure requiring more than 1 medication
- Uncontrolled systemic disease
- Known steroid-responder
- Use of systemic steroids - Use of Warfarin/Heparin

group.title: 700 µg Dexamethasone Implant and Laser Photocoagulation
group.description: Initial intravitreal injection of 700 µg dexamethasone with up to 1 additional treatment based on re-treatment criteria. Initial laser photocoagulation with up to 3 additional treatments based on re-treatment criteria.

group.title: Sham Implant and Laser Photocoagulation
group.description: Initial sham injection with up to 1 additional treatment based on re-treatment criteria. Initial laser photocoagulation with up to 3 additional treatments based on re-treatment criteria.

reported_events.desc: The Safety Population was used to assess all serious adverse events (SAEs) and adverse events (AEs) and included all patients who were randomized and treated.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
